intro: Dentaria × killiasii, commonly known as the hybrid toothache plant, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, toothed leaves. The plant produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
